alert.note: Alert for Multnomah; Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 2:57PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon and southwest Washington, including the following counties, in northwest Oregon, Multnomah and Washington. In southwest Washington, Clark. * WHEN...Until 445 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 254 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30-45 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.7 inches are expected over the area in the next hour with upwards of 1-1.5 inches in total possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Battle Ground, Portland Downtown, Vancouver Downtown, Portland, Vancouver, Beaverton, Tigard, Lake Oswego, Tualatin, Milwaukie, Camas, Maywood Park, Rivergrove, Portland Airport, West Haven-Sylvan, West Slope, Hazel Dell South, Garden Home-Whitford and Cedar Mill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
